item.title: Historic July Charter signed
item.description: The Historic July Charter was officially signed on Friday afternoon at the South Plaza of the Jatiya Sangsad Bhaban. Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus and Vice President of the National Consensus Commission Professor Ali Riaz signed the charter, joined by several other political leaders. Amo

item.title: Zelensky to seek weapons from Trump in the shadow of a new Putin summit
item.description: US President Donald Trump will discuss the possible supply of long-range Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine with President Volodymyr Zelensky on Friday but the surprise announcement of a new US-Russian summit cast doubt over the prospect. Trump said on Thursday he may meet Russian President Vladimir Put

item.title: Two probe bodies formed over CEPZ building fire
item.description: Two separate probe committees have been formed to investigate the devastating fire that broke out in a seven-storey building inside the Chattogram Export Processing Zone (CEPZ) area. The fire, which started yesterday afternoon, was finally brought under control this morning after nearly 17 hours o

item.title: July Charter will be implemented soon: Ali Riaz
item.description: Ali Riaz, the vice-president of the National Consensus Commission, has expressed hope that the July National Charter, formulated through political consensus, will be implemented swiftly. He said, “We understand that reform will not be achieved overnight, nor can a document alone guarantee su

item.title: AmCham hosts session on Economic and Investment Outlook in Dhaka
item.description: The American Chamber of Commerce in Bangladesh (AmCham) hosted an engagement session on “AmCham Insights: Economic & Investment Outlook”, on Thursday at the Sheraton in Dhaka. Dr. Fahmida Khatun, Executive Director, Centre for Policy Dialogue (CPD), and Shah Mohammad Mahboob, Executive

item.title: Salahuddin sees path to democracy through July Charter
item.description: BNP Standing Committee Member Salahuddin Ahmed on Friday expressed the hope that Bangladesh will be transformed into a democratic state through the implementation of the July National Charter. Talking to reporters after attending the July Charter signing ceremony at the South Plaza of the Jatiya S

item.title: July Charter: Which political parties signed, which did not
item.description: A total of 25 political parties have signed the July Charter, according to the Chief Adviser’s Press Wing, while several others have not. Those who have signed did it at a ceremony at the South Plaza of the Jatiya Sangsad Bhaban in Dhaka city on Friday afternoon. The parties that signed the

item.title: Jamaat’s Shafiqur blasts interim govt over attack on ‘July warriors’
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami chief Shafiqur Rahman has condemned the interim government after police allegedly attacked participants of the July Movement, describing the incident as “shameful” and “deeply painful”. Speaking at a workers’ rally at Mirpur Dhaka on Friday, Shafiqur s

item.title: Three sent to jail in Malibagh jewellery shop heist case
item.description: A court in Dhaka on Friday sent three people to jail in a case lodged over the sensational jewellery shop theft at Fortune Shopping Mall in Malibagh in the capital on October 8. The three accused are Anita Roy, Md Nurul Islam, and Uttam Chandra Sur. Dhaka Metropolitan Magistrate Mehera Mahbub pas

item.title: Moyeen Khan urges inclusion of ‘July forerunners’ in Charter
